results.title: Market town
results.brief_description: A film about market day in an old Nottinghamshire town. The roads leading to the town are full of traffic, for the country people are bringing their cattle, poultry, fruit and vegetables and other farm produce to market. At the market, farmers show each other sample of grain, crowd the cattle market, and sit about talking of the weather and the prices of the crops - the subject farmers everywhere talk about.

results.title: Marked woman
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Jack L. Warner, Hal B Wallis, Louis F. Edelman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A hard boiled B-girl (Bette Davis), is determined to turn the tables on Mobster Johnny Vanning (Eduardo Ciannelli), who has recently taken over the management of the nightclub where she works and is attempting to turn out the current employees. It proves to be hard task for one individual so she enlists the help of a district attorney (Bogart), and her fellow workers at the nightclub (Rosalind Marquis, Lola Lane, Isabel Jewell and Mayo Methot). This film is based on the trial of New York Gangster Lucky Luciano, sent to prison on the basis of evidence from prostitutes.

results.title: Mark Twain: background for his works
results.brief_description: Using authentic locations, quotations, and re-enactments, this biography provides a background to the study of the work of Mark Twain. The variety and color of Twain’s boyhood on the Mississippi are shown to be a source of his major writings; his other works, as well, are seen to reflect the rich and zestful life of this journalist, yarnspinner and humourist.

results.title: Mark Twain gives an interview
results.brief_description: Hal Holbrook’s clever impersonation of Mark Twain is shown in this recreation of an interview with the American author. Holbrook’s amazing physical resemblance to Twain and his skill in reproducing the author’s mannerisms are combined with the witty and pungent dialogue which characterised Twain’s writing.

results.title: Mark Twain's America
results.creator_credit: Donald B. Hyatt and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description: A record of Mark Twain’s America, using contemporary engravings and photographs. Mark Twain as the storyteller describes the atmosphere as he saw American history during his lifetime. The narration is taken in part from the writings of Twain and his contemporaries. Originally televised in the series “Project 20”, this is one of the longest films yet made based entirely on still photographs and prints. Credits include script by Richard Hanser, music by Robert Russell Bennett, narrated by Howard Lindsay and edited by Silvio D’Alisera.

results.title: Mark Tobey
results.brief_description: An experiment toward the interpretation of a personal vision. Opens with an unusual sequence in which various people comment on Tobey’s abstract paintings on exhibition. The artist is shown in his studio and against the background of the city of Seattle. A poetic voice-over narration accompanies various images suggesting the personal vision of the artist, so that this film emphasises the inner rather than the outer life of the artist. Photographed by William Heick, with narration by Robert Gardner and Mark Tobey.
